channel.title: Green Business Weekly
channel.description: David Ballard interviews the stars of "alternative capitalism" who are making money with "green businesses based on the principles of sustainability, conservation of resources and fair trade.

image.title: Green Business Weekly
image.description: David Ballard interviews the stars of "alternative capitalism" who are making money with "green businesses based on the principles of sustainability, conservation of resources and fair trade.

channel.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: David Ballard interviews the stars of "alternative capitalism" who are making money with "green businesses based on the principles of sustainability, conservation of resources and fair trade.
channel.itunes:summary: David Ballard interviews the stars of "alternative capitalism" who are making money with "green businesses based on the principles of sustainability, conservation of resources and fair trade.
channel.itunes:keywords: yakk, yakkyakk, yakkyakk.com, Business, Corporations, Corporate corruption, green business, environmental business

item.title: Big Oil vs Bio Diesel
item.description: What’s up with Bio Diesel? You hear about it all the time, but is it economically viable? According to David’s guests, yes it is!
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com

item.title: The Earth-Friendly Traveler
item.description: It’s been around for decades but still only represents about 1 percent of our energy generation. David talks with the owner of a self sustaining hotel powered by Solar Energy.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com

item.title: Eating Organic
item.description: David and guests talk about organic farming in this country and around the world, and how it stacks up against food that is grown conventionally or on so-called “factory farms” that use petroleum-based pesticides and fertilizers.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
item.itunes:subtitle: David and guests talk about organic farming in this country and around the world, and how it stacks up against food that is grown conventionally or on so-called “factory farms” that use petroleum-based pesticides and fertilizers.
item.itunes:summary: David and guests talk about organic farming in this country and around the world, and how it stacks up against food that is grown conventionally or on so-called “factory farms” that use petroleum-based pesticides and fertilizers.

item.title: GDTB mANAfesto
item.description: Co-producer Ana Cortez joins David as co-host.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Co-producer Ana Cortez joins David as co-host.
item.itunes:summary: Co-producer Ana Cortez joins David as co-host.

item.title: How to stop Global Warming
item.description: David and Ana talk about the urgency of passing the Global Warming Bill AB 32, and interview Erin Rogers from the Union of Concerned Scientists.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
item.itunes:subtitle: David and Ana talk about the urgency of passing the Global Warming Bill AB 32, and interview Erin Rogers from the Union of Concerned Scientists.
item.itunes:summary: David and Ana talk about the urgency of passing the Global Warming Bill AB 32, and interview Erin Rogers from the Union of Concerned Scientists.

item.title: Fresh News
item.description: Headlines from the Los Angeles green business scene… and beyond.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Headlines from the Los Angeles green business scene… and beyond.
item.itunes:summary: Headlines from the Los Angeles green business scene… and beyond.

item.title: Home Green Home
item.description: Dave and Ana talk about how to make green products and services an everyday part of your home life.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave and Ana talk about how to make green products and services an everyday part of your home life.
item.itunes:summary: Dave and Ana talk about how to make green products and services an everyday part of your home life.

item.title: Now is the Time for the Triple Bottom Line
item.description: Dave and Ana interview green business pioneer Rona Fried of sustainablebusiness.com and progressive green businessman Alex Zarbo of thegreenoffice.com. They both agree that it is imperative for businesses to adopt the "triple bottom line" philosophy.
item.itunes:author: david.ballard@yakkyakk.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave and Ana interview green business pioneer Rona Fried of sustainablebusiness.com and progressive green businessman Alex Zarbo of thegreenoffice.com. They both agree that it is imperative for businesses to adopt the "triple bottom line" philosophy.
